articles.description: ScientiFix, our weekly feature, offers you a summary of the top global science stories of the week, with links to their sources.
articles.content:
Hundreds of mystery fast radio bursts from space
Using a large stationary radio telescope in British Columbia, scientists have detected the largest cache of fast radio bursts discovered to date. The… [+8129 chars]

articles.description: NGC 3254 lies approximately 118 million light-years away in the constellation of Leo Minor. Otherwise known as IRAS 10265+2944, LEDA 30895 and UGC 5685,
